comment.body:
Possibly relevant blog post: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GiJUPsfiS3LWCyZj5urW1Rt2q9WwRh4wB/?Post:10:Project+Swarm:+digital+life+based+on+P2P

> [kaffie](#): Why don't we have an all-in-one cheap PC that makes decentralized computing easy? At the heart could be something like a custom distro of linux with the above software pre-installed, and configured to jump into a new or existing meshnet. The software would run on a cheap pocket computer, like the Raspberry Pi

My thoughts exactly. Man doesn't need a state-of-the-art quad-core machine with bloated-ass software to get networking. All that is needed is some form of P2P connection (I'm thinking meshnets here, but really it could even be bluetooth or infrared) and a platform for P2P computing. To hell with centralized services and the notion of digital property. Sharing and distribution are the future!

Nice!

Could you point to the dent in ZeroMe where you saw the instructions?
